page.title: 13HOUSING IN WOLSTON
page.content: Houses are a mixture of old and new many{privately owned}. The two modern estates on either side of the village centre are mostly detached or semi-detached houses or bungalows. Some have loft extensions to make extra rooms but all are neat and tidy with colourful gardens.{Council houses were built in 1921 but some of these have been sold to sitting tenants. Others have been modernised. A newer estate of rented accommodation has been built in small blocks of terraced housing opposite the first school Annexe. There are some good examples of{Victorian and Georgian} houses originally owned by tradesmen. Part of Frog Hall, on the A45 trunk road, is 419 years old and was an old coaching house.{Thatched cottages}add to the charm of the village. New housing is planned in Dyers Lane.
